New Records: Lionel Messi scored twice in his first international start since November, and Argentina outclassed Guatemala 4-1 to complete its 2024 Copa America preparations.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored twice, assisted on another goal, and struck the woodwork with a free kick.
Lautaro Martinez scored twice for the defending Copa America and World Cup champions.
Guatemala took a surprise lead in the fourth minute, but the lead lasted only eight minutes before Messi tied it.

Messi's feed sprung Valentin Carboni into the right side of the penalty area, forcing Guatemala defender Nicolas Samayoa to haul down the winger with a sliding challenge that resulted in Lautaro Martinez's penalty shot.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi had been absent for half a dozen absences for Inter Miami in MLS play due to a hamstring issue.

Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni said that Messi went the full 90 minutes for manager Lionel Scaloni after playing 35 off the bench in a 1-0 win over fellow Copa America contenders Ecuador on Sunday in Chicago.
Post-Match Reflections: Scaloni said that Messi's sharp performance should ease Argentine concerns ahead of next Thursday's group play opener against Canada in Atlanta.
Scaloni also said that going the distance gave Messi reps with 15 Argentina field players during the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez redirected a chance resulting from a free kick only as far as defender Lisandro Martinez, who inadvertently bundled the ball across the goal line.
Messi finished the scoring in the 77th, chipping Guatemala goalkeeper Nicholas Hagen after playing a give-and-go with Di Maria.
Others: Argentina is the defending Copa America and World Cup champions.
Guatemala is 108th in FIFA's world rankings.
